messages.message:
Hi team,

Incoming newbie crafting questions!

I have my crafting sandbox up and running. I used the ibdev-backend template. I want to eventually get to a state where I can run PDB on api-server and debug something.

My crafting sandbox is https://https--jagjeetwani-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/
However, I noticed Udit's is a different format: https://crafting-aihub--udit-dev-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/

I can't use the shared crafting logins on my sandbox, but it works on Udit's. Is there a reason why?
Related question as well. If the logins are supposed to be different, is there a way for me to create a new login on the ecosystem?

Udit's is using a template which leverages traffic interception, meaning it shares resources with the crafting-aihub cluster, and has an endpoint (`crafting-aihub--udit...`) which uniquely facilitates this. Any sandbox based on a template which isn't `ibdev`/`frontend`/`cypress-ci` does not use traffic interception out of the box

I see. When Udit added my user (<mailto:jagjeet.wani@instabase.com|jagjeet.wani@instabase.com>) to the enterprise org that's on his sandbox (Rocket), it created a new account on his environment, rather than me being added to the org through my sandbox account. Are our two sandboxes operating on different dbs?
I couldn't tell you, the ibdev-backend template runs services similar to ppy, I would check with Matt for help on this
